item.title: Barns
item.dc:creator: Lynn
item.description:
There was a lot of wind and movement in the day, spring in the air.  I found a view of the barns, the sun glinting off of their roofs. Wet earth and slow shadows sat in the yard. “Barns”, oil on linen, 14″ x 18″, Best of Show, BSSS Queen City…

Continue reading
item.content:encoded:
There was a lot of wind and movement in the day, spring in the air.  I found a view of the barns, the sun glinting off of their roofs. Wet earth and slow shadows sat in the yard.

“Barns”, oil on linen, 14″ x 18″, Best of Show, BSSS Queen City Plein Air 2016.

item.title: Looking Forward
item.dc:creator: Lynn
item.description:
I’m looking forward to spring after days in the studio and painting outside in the cold. I painted this in the studio from the inspiration of a small outdoor sketch I did last summer. They are walking in the water in the warmth of the sun. “Two Surfers”, oil on linen,…

Continue reading
item.content:encoded:
I’m looking forward to spring after days in the studio and painting outside in the cold. I painted this in the studio from the inspiration of a small outdoor sketch I did last summer. They are walking in the water in the warmth of the sun.

“Two Surfers”, oil on linen, 12″ x 12″

item.title: Nocturne Painting in the Desert
item.dc:creator: Lynn
item.description:
It was difficult to to see when I looked out from the light of my easel while standing in the loneliness of the empty night desert. When I readjusted my eyes I could see them – like sentient beings spreading their arms to cast shadows. I clung to my original…

Continue reading
item.content:encoded:
It was difficult to to see when I looked out from the light of my easel while standing in the loneliness of the empty night desert. When I readjusted my eyes I could see them – like sentient beings spreading their arms to cast shadows. I clung to my original inspiration, the composition I created of a single ocotillo encompassing all my canvas, the extreme darkness punctuated by glittering stars, the cool desert sand under my feet.

Ocotillo in Starlight, oil on linen, 9″ x 12″

item.title: Gunston Cove
item.dc:creator: Lynn
item.description:
As we motored around to find a fishing spot the winter chill and waning light enveloped everything. We anchored in a quiet cove and I set my paint box on my lap. I focused on the cool/warm relationships of the scene as the red signal light appeared brighter and brighter…

Continue reading
item.content:encoded: As we motored around to find a fishing spot the winter chill and waning light enveloped everything. We anchored in a quiet cove and I set my paint box on my lap. I focused on the cool/warm relationships of the scene as the red signal light appeared brighter and brighter in the settling dusk.

item.title: Boat Launch
item.dc:creator: Lynn
item.description:
Sunset along the water always calls out to me.  After a long, hard day of painting in the heat this summer, I set up my easel at the mouth of a cool river. I focused on the compositional elements of the ever-changing scene, but, allowed the mood to be my…

Continue reading
item.content:encoded:
Sunset along the water always calls out to me.  After a long, hard day of painting in the heat this summer, I set up my easel at the mouth of a cool river. I focused on the compositional elements of the ever-changing scene, but, allowed the mood to be my guide.

Boat Launch, oil on linen, 12″x12″. Best Painting Incorporating Water Award, Paint Annapolis 2015.

item.title: Rocks and Reef
item.dc:creator: Lynn
item.description:
When re-visiting the place where I grew up, I instinctively painted with the combined knowledge of what I absorbed as a child and what I’ve learned since.  

Continue reading
item.content:encoded: When re-visiting the place where I grew up, I instinctively painted with the combined knowledge of what I absorbed as a child and what I’ve learned since.
